pullRequest.title: GG-29901 Implement readiness probe REST endpoint

beforeCommit.message: GG-29901 Implement readiness probe REST endpoint

afterCommit.message: GG-29901 Implement readiness probe REST endpoint

nodes.bodyText:
rather

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * Handler for {@link GridRestCommand#VERSION} and {@link GridRestCommand#NAME} command.
          
          
            
             * Handler for {@link GridRestCommand#PROBE}.

I have a few suggestions about this

Let's just return "false" while this is not ready instead of blocking the call
I think this implementation tells that the node is "ready" too early. The node will be returned from the grid method way before it finished initializing. I even think that the condition IgnitionEx.grid(ctx.igniteInstanceName()) == null is always false - if we've started the REST processor then the node is already obtainable from the grid method.

How about checking the org.apache.ignite.internal.IgnitionEx.IgniteNamedInstance#startLatch latch here? Just check whether the latch's getCount() != 0. Would need to expose it to REST processor somehow though (probably better to expose a method like IgnitionEx.hasStarted(grid) instead of exposing the latch itself).
